Articles.Content:
Thanks for keeping up to date on this!

I skimmed back though the thread and only sound one shot of the airSRBs.
I tried using them on a rocket like normal SRBs, and one fired while the other sparked and rocket did a cartwheel.
Am I using them wrong? XD

By the by, we need to make you your own wiki, given how many parts you're adding to the game...

Edited April 28, 2016 by Venusgate

The single-person bubble-like cockpit utilizes the interstellar mesh switcher- any known bugs that prevent that from being used? (The cockpit is usable, but the mesh flickers between the three different types of meshes.)

@mekan1k: If all three variants are appearing at the same time it means there's an issue with IFS - Double check you have the latest version installed correctly.

@Venusgate: AASRBs need a fair amount of intakeAtm to run. I've found they sometimes require additional intakes on the craft to start them in Augmented mode; I've also found they work better if started in standard mode and switched to Augmented mode once the craft has accelerated to 10m/s or so. I may need to buff their intakes again.

Regarding the wiki, I have started work on some KSPedia pages for M2X, which I should be able to add soon-ish, assuming I can get them to export properly. Currently have pages for things like the AASRBs and Scramjet; are there any other parts that people have found to be non-intuitive/difficult to use properly taht could use a KSPedia entry?

 

Edited April 30, 2016 by SuicidalInsanity

I just wanted to stop by and thank you for all the hard work you put into your mod. I just finished my latest cinematic and I couldnt have done it without you. Your parts are all over this video and I'd really be at a loss creatively without your efforts.  Thank you again and keep up the great work

i dont understand? the rontgen doesnt need liquid fuel anymore ? i attached it to CB-C cockpit and it ran on just simply air and no fuel , also i still dont understand what the fission reactor is used for or how i should use it since there isnt much discriptions with anything specific about the rontgen and fission reactor that i could find on the forums i need a little help understanding the rontgen and fission reactor since the rontgen doesnt seem to need that or any fuel im confused.

amazing mod btw i cant live without it

Edited May 7, 2016 by ThePixeledFox

There is an issue with the service bay with mesh switches. you can adjust the Fuel Switch independently of the mesh switch. I feel the option to change the fuel should be hidden, since the mesh switch already does so.

@ThePixeledFox: Rontgen never used LiquidFuel; it's a Nuclear Thermal Jet, it uses the heat from nuclear fission instead of fuel combustion to generate thrust. Same principle as a Nuclear Thermal Rocket, only difference is the working fluid is atmospheric air instead of LH2. It's used like any other jet engine in the game, only differences are you trade the weight of fuel for the weight of the engine, and it can be used on Eve, Duna, or Jool.
The Fission Reactor is just a nuclear reactor, when turned on it generates a large amount of ElectricCharge that can be used to run ion engines or ISRU parts or anything else that requires ElectricCharge.

@Gnoyze: Looks like the newest version of IFS changed some things; I'll take a look and see what needs to be altered config wise to fix it.

Update 1.7.07 is up, grab it from SpaceDock.
Changelog:

Spoiler

Version 1.7.07
===============================================================
-All cockpits and Science lab now have IVA masks
-Fixed R-71 cockpit airlock colliders
-Fixed CTT MM patch
-Moded Air-Augmented engines to advanced and heavy rocketry tech nodes
-Buffed Airaugmented SRB intakes slightly
-Fixed Podded solar panel missing texture
-Fixed IFS mesh/tank setup not syncing on Service Bay
-Added KSPedia pages

 

Edited May 9, 2016 by SuicidalInsanity

@SuicidalInsanity

I really like these (and your MK3) parts, you've nailed it. Bravo!

A couple of questions and comments, specifically about the Air Augmented SRB's:

  • "size 0.0 0.2" Both AASRBs are missing a number of equal signs in the effects sections; iirc it was something like 12 in the Boost-O-Tron and probably the same in the other one.
  • Putting a decoupler module and an engine module in the same part causes Kerbal Engineer to not register the added deltaV from that part in the editor (at least it used to work this way a couple of versions back). This might not be of a concern to you, but I figured I'd mention it in case someone files a bug report about it. Basically KER assumes the Engine gets decoupled before it gets used (even with staging = false)...I once put decouplers in all SRBs and it drove me nuts trying to figure out why they seemingly wouldn't "work" in the VAB.
  • Are they supposed to be throttle locked/allow shut down false?
  • I only really looked at the Boost-O-Tron closely, but are the um, Mutli-modal thrust figures backwards? I say this as some one who doesn't really understand curves and such, but on first blush, it seems like the Standard mode of the SRB always puts out more thrust and always produces less heat than the Air-Augmented mode (again, that is assuming there is no fancy magic happening with curves). I guess my frame of reference is the LOX Boosted multi-modal Atomic engines from various mods, just with different resources. That might be a bit of a stretch, but it's the only example I can think of off the top of my head, and probably explains my confusion. Please clarify if I'm wrong, as I really like this idea.
  • edit: setting a min thrust value above zero can be bad voodo as it makes it so the user can't scale back the SRB thrust in the editor (KW rocketry has that issue big time)
  • edit2: you're also packaging an out of date MM version (.23); latest is (.24) and earlier ones won't work at all with 1.1.12 I believe.
  • edit3: I believe "thrustProviderModuleIndex = 0" actually refers to the MultiMode Module, as it throws an error in the log (no thrust provider module found at index 0).

All I got at the moment relating to those.

Cheers.

Edited May 10, 2016 by Deimos Rast

@Deimos Rast I haven't noticed issues with the FX in action, so I don't think there's an issue with them missing, but I can add them in.
-Was unaware of the KER issue; I haven't gotten any bug reports about it yet, but I'll keep it in mind.
-No, because dual cycle engines and AllowShutdown = False don't play nice with each other
-There is fancy magic happening with the curves, thrust and ISP scale with mach. Looking at previous versions, it looks like the lowered thrust was a result of buffing the engines and missing/forgetting to buff the augmented mode. I'll have to fix that.
-The minthrust value came about at the same time AllowShutdown was removed, at the time I thought Throttlelocked needed to be removed for dual-cycle SRBs to work, and the Minthrust value was added as a workaround to it being removed. A quick test shows that either I was wrong about that or 1.1 changed things; since it's messing with editor thrust scaling, I'll fix it.
-MM version will be updated.
-Yeah, looking at other configs, it needs to point to ModuleEngineFX, Which it isn't for the AAREs, One more thing to fix.

Thanks for the feedback!

Not sure if this is relevant since CLS is not updated yet for 1.1.2, but I think these lines found in the file M2X_CLS.cfg are not right:

@PART[M2X_TunaCockpit|M2X_BladeCockpit|M2X_DropshipCockpit|M2X_RavenCockpit|M2X_ViperCockpit|M2X_Hub|M2X_THub|M2X_LHub|M2X_SmallLab|M2X_ShieldedDockingPort|M2X_SCRCS|M2X_Endcap|M2X_AligningDockingPort|M2X_EngineShroud|M2X_RadialMountA|M2X_RadialMountB]:HAS[!MODULE[ModuleConnectedLivingSpace]]:FOR[Mk2Expansion]
{
    MODULE
    {
        name = ModuleConnectedLivingSpace
        passable = true
    }
}

 

Specifically: :HAS[!MODULE[ModuleConnectedLivingSpace]

@Galenmacil: The patch is working correctly; the [!HasModule[ModuleConnectedLivingSpace] is simply telling MM to look at the listed parts, and for each part that does not have a ModuleConectedLivingSpace, MM adds one. The warnings are happening because I forgot to add a :NEEDS[ConnectedLivingSpace] tag which is causing MM to add in a ModuleConnectedLivingSpace to those parts regardless of CLS being installed or not. Without CLS installed, the added ModuleConnsetedLivingSpaces are empty garbage modules that the game will throw up a warning about not being able to find, but are otherwise harmless.

Either Interstellar fuel switch or mk2 expansion causes a bug with part welder , it makes monoprop and xenon dissapear after welding  i use mk2 expansion which uses IFS never used to have a problem with it before the latest update now i can't weld monoprop and xenon anymore. I was wondering what could be causing it since older versions of mk2 and IFS welded fine before.

PS: mk2 expansion has always welded fine before (still does) but my test weld this morning used just stock parts, so i have certainly isolated the issue must be comming from interstellar fuel switch but im not sure if you know about it, thank again for a must have mod and all the hard work

Hello

Could someone be kind explain how to use the Rontgen Atomic thermal jet and the Nuk 3 Aerospace fission reactor ?

Do I need the Nuk 3 to run the Rontgen ?

I guess i must activate reactor before toggling Rontgen Engine, do need something else that enriched uranium stocked in the Rontgen to get thrust? Is there a reaction and temperature to reach to get thrust...?

Thank you

Edited May 19, 2016 by gilflo

7 minutes ago, gilflo said:

Hello

Could someone be kind explain how to use the Rontgen Atomic thermal jet and the Nuk 3 Aerospace fission reactor ?

Do I need the Nuk 3 to run the Rontgen ?

I guess i must activate reactor before toggling Rontgen Engine, do need something else that enriched uranium stocked in the Rontgen to get thrust? Is there a reaction and temperature to reach to get thrust...?

I understand you trade fuel against atmospheric fluid. Does it run only on non oxygen atmosphere, because when I start it on runway, there's no thrust, no core heat.....

Thank's

@Drakoan: Known issue - it's a stock bug. For whatever reason, station hubs, be they stock or mod, don't get working symmetry

@gilflo: The reactor is a power generator; think of it like a large Fuelcell, except it doesn't need LF/O and instead needs radiators. The Rontgen is like any other jet engine, except it doesn't need LiquidFuel and will work in non-oxygenated atmospheres. If you have Near Future Electrical installed, then the Rontgen is patched to use NFE's nuclear engine code, which adds a reactor heat mechanic - engine usage is mostly unchanged from stock, except you need to turn the Rontgen's reactor module on first and let it spool up to operating temperature before the engine will produce thrust.
Thank you for answer SucidalInsanity
I have found that using more than 1 sledgehammer causes any other sledgehammers to be denied air intake as 1 engine sucks the lot from the others, is this normal ?

You almost certainly need Moar Intakes.

Sledgehammers want a lot of intake air. With how intakes work in 1.1, there are two options available. The first is enough intakes to make sure the engines are properly supplied, since they have air requirements about on par with the Goliath jet engine. The second option is to start the sledgehammers at less than full thrust on launch/add the engine mode toggle to an action group, start in standard mode. As the craft accelerates even just a few m/s, the intakes' flow rate will rapidly increase, increasing the amount of gathered intake air, and the sledgehammers can be set to full throttle/switched over,

The second option is to start the sledgehammers at less than full thrust on launch/add the engine mode toggle to an action group, start in standard mode. As the craft accelerates even just a few m/s, the intakes' flow rate will rapidly increase, increasing the amount of gathered intake air, and the sledgehammers can be set to full throttle/switched over,

thank you i will try this

I cannot generate any thrust with the "Pluto" on the runway or in VAC. I am using liquid hydrogen in a mk2 rocket fuel tank via interstellar fuel switch. The engine fires up and there is a plume, but thrust stays at zero. I am using kerbal atomics. Is that the problem?  I also cannot surface attach anything to the "Pluto", including radiators . Any help would be appreciated!

 

Thanks!

@Mr_Breeze: Kerbal Atomics shouldn't be a problem, since the Pluto lacks a LH2 patch for KA. Since it's firing and there is an exhaust plume, but no thrust, it sounds like you also have Near Future Electrical installed - NFE adds reactors to NTRs that need to be turned on and spooled up to operating temperature before NTRs will produce thrust. Not sure what to say about the Pluto lacking surface attach, since neither the stock Nerv nor any of KA's nuke engines have surface attach enabled either. If surface attach is needed, you could edit the Pluto's .cfg and change "attachRules = 1,0,1,0,0" to "attachRules = 1,0,1,1,0".

@everyone: M2X 1.7.10 is now up in the usual places (Spacedock/Github). 1.7.10 fixes an issue with the aligning docking port not working with standard size 1 Clamp-O-Trons. It also adds Kerbal Atomics and Tweakscale support. Credit to Rushligh for the tweakscale MM cfg.
Download link on spacedock seems to be broken. Awesome mod btw, Can't play without it

You're probably right. I remember turning the reactor on at one point. I think I kept it off to cut down on heat generation, I didn't know it was needed to run the engine. I don't have a lot of experience with Nuclear. I guess I need to devote some time to learning the inns and outs.

I expected the pluto to have surface attach enabled since it is in the mk2 housing, and your other engines have it enabled. I am going to edit the .cfg. Thanks for the tip. I want to put radiators directly on the engine housing.
